Deprecated API

  • For Removal
  • Interfaces
  • Classes
  • Exceptions

  • For Removal 
    Element Description
    tools.gui.border.IOBorder
    This class relies heavily on ImageManager, which was completely refactored, and behaviour of this class has not yet been tested with the new implementation.
    Border-like users should use SheetBorder instead, as the dependancy with the ImageManager is completely removed there.
    tools.gui.Button
    This class relies heavily on ImageManager, which was completely refactored, and behaviour of this class has not yet been tested with the new implementation.
    Button-like users should use SheetButton instead, as the dependancy with the ImageManager is completely removed there.
    tools.gui.Button2
    This class relies heavily on ImageManager, which was completely refactored, and behaviour of this class has not yet been tested with the new implementation.
    Button-like users should use SheetButton instead, as the dependancy with the ImageManager is completely removed there.
    tools.gui.Slider
    Ancient class. Should be thrown away.
    tools.io.FileTools.forEachFile​(File, Consumer<File>)
    The functionality already exists in FileTree.
    tools.io.ZipTool
    Ancient class. Should be removed.
    tools.MultiTool.forEach​(C, MultiTool.SourceConsumer<C, V>)
    Replaced by ArrayTools.forEach(java.lang.Object, java.util.function.Consumer)
  • Interfaces 
    Interface Description
    tools.observer.HashObservableInterface
    This implementation can be used for quick building up a model, but will become slow when overused in too many classes. It also doesn't have destruction handler, so this interface cannot be used for classes which are constantly being created over time.
  • Classes 
    Class Description
    tools.BufferedImageAlpha
    needs to be reviewed before being used anywhere.
    tools.gui.border.IOBorder
    This class relies heavily on ImageManager, which was completely refactored, and behaviour of this class has not yet been tested with the new implementation.
    Border-like users should use SheetBorder instead, as the dependancy with the ImageManager is completely removed there.
    tools.gui.Button
    This class relies heavily on ImageManager, which was completely refactored, and behaviour of this class has not yet been tested with the new implementation.
    Button-like users should use SheetButton instead, as the dependancy with the ImageManager is completely removed there.
    tools.gui.Button2
    This class relies heavily on ImageManager, which was completely refactored, and behaviour of this class has not yet been tested with the new implementation.
    Button-like users should use SheetButton instead, as the dependancy with the ImageManager is completely removed there.
    tools.gui.MultiFileSelector
    Complete refactoring needed.
    tools.gui.ProgressBar
    Complete refactoring needed.
    tools.gui.Slider
    Ancient class. Should be thrown away.
    tools.ImageTools
    old class. Implementations are slow and might be broken.
    tools.io.ZipTool
    Ancient class. Should be removed.
    tools.numbers.BigDecimalTool
    Old class, and needs to be refactored.
    tools.numbers.BigIntegerTool
    Old class, and needs to be refactored.
    tools.numbers.PrimitiveNumber
    Old class, and needs to be refactored.

    Old class, and needs to be refactored.

    Old class, and needs to be refactored.

    Old class, and needs to be refactored.
    tools.Sort

    Old class, and needs to be refactored.

  • Methods 
    Method Description
    tools.data.collection.rb_tree.LinkedRBTree.search​(RBSearch<D>)
    This function should not be used in the linked variant of the tree.
    Use the LinkedRBKey.parent(), LinkedRBKey.left(), LinkedRBKey.right(), LinkedRBKey.next() and LinkedRBKey.prev() functions instead.
    tools.io.BufferedReaderPlus.read()
    Function cannot and shouldn't be implemented.
    tools.io.FileTools.forEachFile​(File, Consumer<File>)
    The functionality already exists in FileTree.
    tools.MultiTool.deepArrayClone​(T[])
    One should clone the array type specific to reduce the runtime significantly. This is because array creation via reflect is very inefficient since it uses native code, hence it cannot be optimized via the JIT.
    tools.MultiTool.deepClone​(V)
    One should clone the array type specific to reduce the runtime significantly. This is because array creation via reflect is very inefficient since it uses native code, hence it cannot be optimized via the JIT. Moreover, a lot of cases are not supported.
    tools.MultiTool.forEach​(C, MultiTool.SourceConsumer<C, V>)
    Replaced by ArrayTools.forEach(java.lang.Object, java.util.function.Consumer)
  • Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    tools.Sort()
